introduction: Series 1 (Evening) Episode 1 of 4DURATION: 30 MINUTESGloria Hunniford reveals how manufacturers create fictional place names to get shoppers to part with their cash, and why a product described as one of your five a day could actually be bad for your health. Also featuring a look at the soups that contain a lot less than the label promises.首集的主題是「食品標籤」，主持人Gloria發現許多被標籤為「優質」的食物，原來殊不健康！某些英國食品製造商就濫用了「每日五份蔬果」標籤，將許多含高糖份的食品包裝成人們每天必吃的健康食品；而許多自稱為「走地雞」的雞肉，其實都名不符實；許多三文魚被標籤為出產自著名三文魚產地「Nordmeier」，但「Nordmeier」這個地方卻竟然不存在！就連一包煮意粉用的「雞肉磨菇醬」，經檢測過後竟被發現不含任何雞肉成分，更只有8%成分為磨菇……不想再誤墮「食物騙局」？萬勿錯過《食得精明》！(摘自:http://programme.tvb.com/foodandtravel/ripofffood/episode/1/)[Series 1 (Evening) Episode 2 of 4DURATION: 30 MINUTESGloria Hunniford looks at how much sugar there is in products that market themselves as healthy foods, and reveals the truth about flavoured waters. Plus the ingredients that are found in diet food that could also be used by your decorator.[Series 1 (Evening) Episode 3 of 4DURATION: 30 MINUTESThis episode reveals the foods that promise top quality but deliver much less. Could the cod you're eating really be Vietnamese catfish? And is there more to your bottle of olive oil than first meets the eye?[Series 1 (Evening) Episode 4 of 4DURATION: 30 MINUTESGloria finds out which comes out on top in the battle between tap and bottled water. Plus a look at the real price of pre-prepared vegetables, and the special offers that may not be quite what they seem.
